The crude methanol extracts of A. nubica (MIC50 1 µg/ml), N. sativa (MIC50 1 µg/ml) and B. papyrifera (MIC50 1 µg/ml) were more active than those from E. caryophilus (MIC50 25 µg/ml), C. verum (MIC50 25 µg/ml), P. nigrum (MIC50 25 µg/ml) and Z. officinalis (MIC50 12.5 µg/ml) .
